intro: Noccaea cikaea, commonly known as the alpine nailwort, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are alternate, often with a basal rosette structure, and the flowers are usually pink or purple in color. Noccaea cikaea is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
